newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japan to form Russian gas consortium by Dec-trader.
newsitem.headline: Japan to form Russian gas consortium by Dec-trader.

text.p: Japanese trading houses, oil exploration firms and steel manufacturers are expected to form a consortium to join a Sino-Russian natural gas pipeline project by the end of the year, traders said on Wednesday.

China and Russia reached preliminary agreement last spring on a multibillion-dollar plan to build a pipeline to send natural gas from Russia's eastern Siberia to China, and possibly to South Korea and Japan.
The pipeline route has not been decided, but one of the suggested courses is one from gas-rich Irkutsk near Lake Baikal, through Mongolia to the Yellow Sea, they said.

Japanese participation is expected help Japan secure a cheap, stable supply of natural gas, widely regarded as clean energy, while giving the Sino-Russian side much-needed financial support for the massive project, traders said.

The estimated cost of the project ranges from $4.5 billion to as much as $14.4 billion if the pipeline was extended all the way to Kitakyushu in western Japan, said Mikhail Surtsukov of Sidanco, Russia's fourth-biggest oil company in terms of reserves.
Surtsukov told at a seminar earlier this week in Tokyo that the Kovyktinskoye field in Irkutsk has 870 billion cubic metres (30.6 trillion cubic feet) of proven gas reserves.
